svg.text: sociology
It is ironic that governments be not structured for the
benefit of society, but for the exploitation of
population. It is ironic that war in the large reflects
whore in the small, but should remain poorly understood
while a common and universal observable. It is ironic
that law as the conservation of the freedom of
egalitarianism and security as proletarianism should be
doubted as legislation, adjudication, enforcement, and
reinforcement.
Rather, it is true that the common and universal conflict
of society is moral sanity differentiated from moral
apathy and moral insanity. That the prevalence of
nihilism obscures the prevalence of humanism by the
fictions of manipulation, exploitation, and annihilation
found in the distraction, deflection, deception,
deprivation, and depredation of nihilism that we
criminalize in the conservation of individualistic
independence, socialistic interdependence, and communistic
dependence.
